Emily was incredibly smart, bookish or nerdy some might say, being a whiz when it came to anything science-related, and you'd initially gotten to know each other after being paired up on a chemistry project in class, Emily pretty much doing all the work and helping you to understand what the hell was going on, science definitely not being your thing. You had to admit, you'd never really noticed her before that, not particularly standing out from the crowd and your eyes, like many others, having been more focused on girls like Tammy and Jessica, girls who were way out of your league and wouldn't even give you the time of day (not being exactly the most popular or handsome person in school yourself).

Emily was different though, some might say kind of plain, and from her outward appearance you could probably agree with that; dressing sort of mousy-ish, with her short, brown hair, held in place by an Alice band, thick, black glasses and cute patch of tiny orange freckles decorating her face, while her small, scrawny 5 foot 1 inch figure was usually clothed in a thick sweater and long plaid skirt, not really having the greatest fashion sense in the world. But that didn't really matter to you, figuring as you'd never get any of those beauty queen girls to go out with you in a million years, Emily was cute enough, once you got past the nerdy, shy exterior, and funny too, often making you laugh when she wasn't rattling on about mathematics or physics or anything else you couldn't get your head round.

All and all you were pretty happy with Emily (despite the jokes others would often make towards you), and even though you'd yet to get past the kissing and fondling stage of the relationship, you were hoping you'd soon take things a step further and that she'd be your first.

"So, how was last period History?" you asked her as you released her from your embrace and took her small hand in yours, heading down the corridor with the rest of the school traffic, "Cause Gym class was a total drag, I think I had about eight guys jump on top of me playing football today."

"Oh, you know, it was okay," she smiled, snuggling closer to your body as you headed out the doors, another school day finally being over, and the rest of the day now completely your own.

"Well, you want to come over to mine? We can hang out for a while, if you've got nothing else planned."

"Sure, yeah," she said happily, being quite comfortable over at yours, her shyness sometimes getting the better of her at some places, but not at yours, her and your mom seeming to get on quite well, and as you didn't have any other siblings or anything (your dad having gone AWOL when you were only 6), she was the only one that needed to approve.

"Okay, my house it is then," you grinned, as you both turned and headed down the sidewalk.

- - -

Returning home, you were welcomed by your mother, Sarah, who was busy messing around with the laundry and happy to see Emily with you, glad that you'd finally managed to find a nice (if a little quiet) girlfriend who didn't use you and treat you like crap, as your last foray into the field of dating had, a couple of years ago (the girl in question being Becky Thomas, whom you'd met at summer camp and had dropped you almost as soon as the next guy came along). After stopping for a brief chat with your mom, you and Emily then grabbed a drink and a plate of cookies and headed up to your bedroom to listen to some music, while Emily got her chemistry homework finished, and you messed around on your Xbox while you waited.

"Your mom really is pretty, isn't she?" Emily suddenly said, looking up from her books and turning towards you.

"Uh, I dunno...I guess," you replied, a little taken aback, the question seemingly coming out of nowhere.

"Well, I think she is anyway," she continued, looking rather thoughtful and giving you a funny little smile, "She's got really nice, long hair, and she's so tall and curvy, I wish I could look like that."

This was certainly a weird conversation and you weren't entirely sure how to react to it, as you dropped your Xbox controller and turned to face your girlfriend. "You look just fine to me," you told her, figuring she was having a crisis of image or something, "If you were all tall and curvy, you wouldn't be so cute and adorable."

This caused her to giggle, blushing again like she always did whenever you said something like that, her soft cheeks turning a rosy pink color. "Heh-heh, thanks," she replied, brushing her hair back with a hand and turning away slightly embarrassed. Smiling to yourself, figuring you'd successfully done your job, you picked up your controller again and returned to shooting terrorists, chuckling a little to yourself at how cute Emily looked when she got all shy.

However, it appeared she wasn't done quite yet, after a minute or two, starting up again with, "She's really confident too, and funny, and you guys seem so close."

"Well, she is my mom," you laughed, "That mother/son bond thing'll do that."

"Yeah..."

"What's with the sudden interest in my mom, anyways?" you asked, becoming curious why she was bringing all this up, having mentioned the odd comment about liking your mother before, but never anything like this (though you figured it may have something to do with her not getting along that great with her own parents, but who really knew?)

Emily simply gave you a cute little smile in reply and said, "Oh, no reason," before sticking her head back into her books and leaving you none the wiser of what was going through her mind.

Where will this story go next? Your choices are below...
122.title: Emily Stuart

choices: Clarissa stops you in the hallway after class.
Emily accuses you of flirting with Clarissa and you argue.
1222.content:
An addition by: Wassel29

The following day, you woke up with a yawn, having stayed up way too late after Emily had left, playing on your Xbox and trying to finish an impossible level, clearly feeling the repercussions of it now. Quickly getting washed and showered, you then threw on your school clothes and headed down stairs, where your mom was waiting for you with a cheery smile on her face and a bowl of cereal on the table.

"Morning," she said, as you trundled in, somehow always managing to appear bright and breezy first thing, while you just wanted to go back to sleep. "You weren't up all night playing that game again, were you?" she then asked with a frown, being quite perceptive, your tired eyes giving you away.

"Not all night..." you feebly replied, grabbing your chair and sitting down at the table, awaiting a lecture, which sure enough, soon followed.

Once your mom had finished giving you a telling off, you then got stuck into your breakfast, munching away and thinking back to all those questions Emily had been asking last night. It had seemed kind of odd, now that you thought about it, that she'd actually said she wanted to look like your mom; your mother being a 41 year old woman, and not particularly the kind of person that young women usually aspired to look like, some super model or movie star maybe, but not your mom! Sure, objectively at least, you guessed she was kind of pretty, with her long blond hair, and soft, gentle face, her body also being nice and curvy (for an older woman that is) with quite a large a prominent chest. Still, she was of course your mother, and you certainly didn't want your girlfriend looking the same, that would be just too creepy for words.

Shaking the thought out of your head, and figuring Emily was just being silly, you quickly finished up your cereal and said goodbye to your mother, fearing that if you didn't get a move on, you were going to end up late for class.

"Catch you later," you said, giving her a quick kiss on the cheek, before heading out the door, hearing her reply with, "Have a good day, sweetheart, and don't forget we're going out for dinner tonight!"

- - -

School, as per usual was pretty boring, not really excelling at any subject in particular, but at the same time, doing enough to get by, and by the time 3rd period Chemistry came round, you were at least thankful that you'd managed to wake up a bit, smiling as you walked into the classroom and saw Emily sitting there at your desk.

"Hey, Em," you said, as you sat down next to her, having not seen her since she left your house last night and giving her a quick kiss (which instantly had the effect of turning her face bright crimson, still getting used to the idea of public affection).

"Heya, Dave," she smiled back, giggling a little as she blushed, before pulling her books out of her bag and asking, "Hows your day been so far?"

"All the better for seeing you," you replied, happily, fetching out your own textbook, then watching as Mr. Harrison, your Chemistry teacher walked in the door, hushing the entire class with his presence.

While Emily became engrossed in what the teacher was saying, scribbling down formulas and notes in her notebook, even before Mr. Harrison had said them, you weren't quite so enthralled, your teacher's rather slow, monotonous voice practically putting you to sleep as he droned on about stuff that really didn't interest you, and you were doing all you could just to stay awake. That's when you heard a little whisper at your side, and looked round to see one of your other classmates, Clarissa Smith leaning over to speak to you.

"Psst, hey David," she whispered, flashing you a smile, "Have you got an eraser I can borrow?"

"Uh, yeah, sure," you replied, scrambling around your desk to find one, a little surprised to find Clarissa actually speaking to you, having sat across from her for the best part of a year and not having heard her say one word. Locating Emily's eraser, hidden underneath one of your books, you passed it across to her and watched as she thanked you with another beautiful smile, your eyes lingering for a moment on her pretty face and attractive figure.

"Thanks a lot," she said after she was finished, passing it back to you, and drawing the attention of Emily, who looked up from her notebook rather inquisitively, surely wondering why Clarissa, a outwardly much more attractive and confident girl, was currently smiling away at her boyfriend. You didn't really give it too much thought however, and instead simply returned to trying your best to stay awake as Mr. Harrison's boring lecture continued on.

Where will this story go next? Your choices are below...
1222.title: The following morning.

choices: You manage to calm down Emily and talk things over.
Emily storms off jealous and upset.
12221.content:
An addition by: Wassel29

After the bell went, you quickly grabbed up your stuff, glad the class was finally over, then waited patiently for Emily to finish scribbling away in her notebook, wondering to yourself why the hell she even bothered, having got an A+ for every single science test she'd ever taken (presumably inheriting her scientific knowledge from her parents, her dad being some sort of geneticist while her mother was a Biochemist).

"Em, hey! Put the book down," you joked to get her attention, causing her to look up and notice that everyone else was leaving, "Chemistry will still be here tomorrow, you'd don't have to write everything down now!"

"Sorry," she said, letting out a nervous giggle, having been so engrossed in what she was writing, that she hadn’t even heard the bell.

Grabbing up her books, you then escorted her out of the classroom, chuckling away as you discussed Mr. Harrison and his ridiculously boring lectures, surprised to find that she actually agreed with you, and rather less surprised to learn that she already knew everything he was teaching.

"No wonder you get so many A's," you laughed as you passed her the textbooks, jokingly adding "Heck, I should probably start listening to my mom a little more when she talks about work, maybe then I'd get an A+ in...marketing. Okay, well maybe not then."

"You shouldn't make fun, I'm sure your mom's job is very important," Emily said rather defensively, not particularly caring for your flippant disregard for your mother's career, or taking it for what it was, a joke. Before you could reply though, another voice suddenly chipped in and you noticed Clarissa standing behind you, having apparently been waiting for you outside.

"Hey David," she said with a cheery little wave, her pretty face perfectly framed by her golden blond hair, adding, a little less enthusiastically, "...and uh, hi Emily..."

"Clarissa, hey, what's up?" you said, rather stunned that Clarissa was talking to you twice in one day, while Emily seemed a little less happy about that fact.

Basically ignoring Emily (which was admittedly easy for her, seeing how Clarissa was much taller, and closer to your own 5' 11"), Clarissa then told you, rather excitedly, "Well, I don't know if you've heard or not, but Jessica and some of the other girls are having this big party at her house this Saturday, while her parents are out of town,and it's so going to be huge! Anyway, me and Nicole are basically on invite duty, and I was just wondering if you maybe wanted to come?"

"Wow!" you thought, completely taken aback, never having been popular enough or moved in the correct social circles to recieve one before for one of Jessica Caldwell's legendary parties, and wondering what you'd done to deserve one now. "I uh, well I'm not sure..." you stuttered, a little at a loss for words, before quickly remembering Emily standing beside you, indicating towards her and asking, "Is uh, is Emily invited too?"

"Sure, I guess," Clarissa sort of shrugged, as she began fiddling with a locket on her neck, which you found your eyes suddenly being drawn too, momentarily hypnotized by the rather impressive cleavage underneath. Quickly snapping yourself out of your trance, and looking down at Emily's un-amused face, feeling a little guilty for staring at another girls chest, you figured you'd best talk with her about it first and see if she wanted to go(seeing as she wasn't so good with social gatherings) before giving Clarissa a proper answer, explaining to her that, " it sounds great, but we should probably talk it over first, you know, make sure it doesn't clash with anything. Thanks though, Clarissa."

"No problem, hope you can make it," she smiled, giving you another cutesy little wave, before spinning on her heels and heading off back down the corridor towards her waiting friends.

"Wow, can you believe that?" you said, looking back down at Emily, feeling totally buzzed at having miraculously climbed the school social ladder after so many years of being at the bottom, "Jessica Caldwell's party, when did we get popular enough to get invited to something like that?"

Emily however, wasn't looking quite so impressed, clearly aware of something you weren't. "We didn't," she said rather bluntly, slinging her schoolbag over her shoulder, "You did."

"What do you mean? Clarissa just invited the two of us?" you asked her, somewhat confused as she started walking down the hall, quickly following after her as she moved at an accelerated pace.

"She only invited me cause I was there. Girls like Clarissa don't invite girls like me to parties unless they have to."

"I'm not sure I follow..."

"She likes you, David, that's why she asked you," Emily explained, looking a little upset as she did, "She was totally flirting back there, don't tell me you didn't notice!"

"Wait...she was?" you asked somewhat in disbelief, having totally not read the situation that way, and pretty certain there was no chance in hell someone like Clarissa Smith could actually be into you, her being one of the top ten most attractive girls in the year, and you, probably not even in the top 100 guys. It just didn't make any sense, surely Emily was just imagining things, you thought, as you continued to chase after her down the hall, desperate to explain to her that it wasn't what it seemed.

Where will this story go next? Your choices are below...
12221.title: An innocent invitation?

choices: Some small changes in Emily the next day.
Some big changes in Emily the next day.
122211.content:
An addition by: Wassel29

It took you a while (most of the day in fact), but you eventually managed to calm Emily down, doing your best to assure her that there was no way Clarissa had any interest in you, and you figured that the only reason she’d probably invited you was just to pad out the numbers, Jessica's parties usually being fairly massive and seeing as you weren't really one of the jock crowd or the nerd crowd, she figured you'd maybe be a safe bet. That at least seemed a far more likely situation in your eyes than her actually fancying you.

You could tell however, that Emily wasn't quite so convinced, and lacking somewhat in the self esteem department was seemingly worried that you were going to ditch her for Clarissa, which of course was ridiculous (the thought of going out with someone as smoking hot as Clarissa actually making you chuckle), and you told Emily as much, hoping it would sink in, though not entirely sure it would, having gotten the impression in the past that she thought you were as much out of her league as Clarissa was out of yours.

"I just don't want you running off with some other girl," Emily said, her cheeks flushed and her eyes a little bleary as you stood together outside the school gates.

"I'm not going to, seriously, Em, it's just you and me," you told her, holding her small body tightly in your arm to comfort her, "Screw Jessica Caldwell's party! We can just do something else on Saturday instead."

"Really? You sure?" she sniffed, looking up at you with her big green eyes.

"Really," you replied, with a smile, inwardly feeling a little disappointed, having wanted to experience what one of these big house parties was actually like, but deciding it best to keep Emily happy, not wanting to rock the boat any more. Hugging you tightly now, she pressed her head against your chest and you stood there in an embrace for a few minutes, as the last of the school filtered past, heading home, which you would have to do soon too.

"So, we all good now?" you asked, the length of Emily's extended hug getting a little awkward, hoping that she was over the whole "Clarissa fancying you" thing, which you were fairly certain wasn't true (though the idea that it could be, was actually pretty cool).

"Yeah, I guess," Emily replied, her voice not sounding a 100% convincing as she broke from the hug and flashed you a weak little smile. It had to be said, that as cool and cute as Emily was, and as much as you liked being with her, sometimes her hang-ups and inadequacies could be a little trying, as if she was constantly seeking validation that you wanted to be with her, and only her (and what with only being 17 and her only your second girlfriend, was something that was kind of hard to promise).

Composing herself again, and rubbing her eyes a little, she then looked back up at you and asked, somewhat hopefully, "Can we go back to your house now, and maybe hang out for a while?"

"Sure," you told her, wrapping an arm round her shoulder, before suddenly remembering that your mother was planning on taking you out tonight. "Arg, wait..." you groaned, not particularly wanting to break it to Emily, but seeing no way around it, telling her, rather apologetically that, "My mom's actually taking me out to some restaurant tonight, she got a promotion a few weeks back and she's been going on about going out somewhere nice to celebrate, just the two of us...I'm real sorry Em, maybe tomorrow?"

Her face sort of dropped as you said this, and she was clearly disappointed, her mouth twitching a little as she quickly tried to cover it up, "No, that's, that's fine. Tomorrow is fine," making you feel somewhat bad, undeservedly so. It was your mom who had planned it after all, and you an Emily weren't exactly joined at the hip or anything, what were you supposed to do?

- - -

The next day, thankfully, Emily seemed in a little better spirits, though slightly more distracted, her mind seemingly on other things as she furiously scribbled away in her notebook in and out of class, weird formulas and equations you were pretty certain you'd never seen in any textbook before, and when you asked her about them, all she said was that it was "for an extra credit project I'm working on", which you supposed was good enough for you. She did seem pretty interested in your night out though, her face almost appearing to light up when you mentioned your mother, as you told her about where you went, what you had to eat, what you talked about, etc. To be honest, even to you it was pretty boring, but Emily seemed intrigued, and it momentarily made you think about that comment she'd made a few days ago, about wanting to be like your mother, but you quickly dismissed it again, thinking it crazy.

As well as that, you also began to notice Clarissa around a lot more, having told her that you wouldn't be able to make the party due to some excuse or another you’d made up, but finding that she still stopped to talk to you every now and then, making you wonder if Emily had been right all along (though telling yourself that it didn't matter either way, Emily being the one for you). Emily no doubt noticed this too, but unlike last time she didn't say anything, even though you could tell she was thinking it, and just continued scribbling away in her book while you just tried to casually shrug off the idea that a beautiful girl like Clarissa would be interested in you.

Once school was over, as promised, you headed back to your house and were once again greeted by your mom. After the usual small talk and pleasantries, you headed up to your bedroom and made out for a while, Emily letting you put your hands up her shirt, which while nice, wasn't really much of an experience, Emily's chest being virtually nonexistent, and if it hadn't been for her pointy nipples, you could have almost been fondling yourself (as a fan of big breasts, it was admittedly quite disappointing, sometimes wishing that she had a rack like your old girlfriend Becky, or even Clarissa who had to be about at least a C cup).

"Oh well, when life gives you a lemon, make lemonade!" you chuckled to yourself as you continued your groping, the fact that Emily was a girl being good enough for you.

Where will this story go next? Your choices are below...
122211.title: Inadequate girlfriend

choices: You invite Emily back to your house.
Emily rushes back home after school.
1222111.content:
An addition by: Wassel29

The next day, you awoke slightly more refreshed than you had the previous morning, having managed to refrain from playing on your Xbox all night, and having experienced some pretty wild dreams instead, dreams you probably wouldn't be sharing with Emily, cause you were pretty certain they involved you and Clarissa Smith, and in them, the two of you were doing a hell of a lot more than just making out!

"Bah, it's just a dream," you told yourself, feeling a little guilty for a moment, "Just cause I'm going out with Em, doesn't mean I can't think about other girls. It's not like anything is going to happen..."

Just then you heard your mother's rather frustrated voice shouting through, snapping you out of your thoughts, as she asked, "David, have you seen my hairbrush?" her voice getting closer as she appeared moments later in the bathroom door, "You know, that old antique one your grandmother gave me?"

"Um, no, can't say I have," you told her, brushing away at your teeth.

"Are you sure you didn't move it? It was sitting on my dresser yesterday evening and now it's completely vanished."

"Yeah, I'm sure," you assured her, not particularly having any reason to steal your mother's hairbrush, and certainly not remembering it even if you had seen it.

Looking rather annoyed, your mom just stood there for a minute staring at you, going over something in her head, before asking, "Well, can you see if Emily saw it while she was here? I really don't want to lose that hairbrush, it's been in the family for years."

"Sure, will do," you said, watching as she then walked away, muttering away to herself and leaving you in peace to return to your thoughts.

- - -

Later, by the time your free period had rolled around in school, you'd already long forgotten what your mother had been going on about this morning, and had so far been once again destroyed in Gym class, and had also had a brief but friendly run in with Clarissa, who'd wanted to borrow your notes for English. You had yet to see Emily though, finding out in Chemistry that she had a doctor’s appointment first thing, and so were currently sat alone in the cafeteria patiently waiting for her to show, just as you always did when you both had the same free period.

"Heya Dave," you heard her voice suddenly say, causing you to look up from the magazine you'd were reading, finding Emily standing behind you.

"Hey, there you are," you smiled, turning in your chair to face her, glad that she'd made it, "I wasn't sure you were going to show, Mr. Harrison said you had a doctor’s app..." Coming face to face with her then, you almost did a double take, as your voice trailed off, not sure if you were seeing things, her small body somehow appearing taller.

"Yeah, sorry I didn't tell you yesterday, It was kind of a last minute thing." she said, her voice rather more cheery than it had been the previous two days, as she grabbed a chair and sat down beside you. "So how are you?" she asked, while you continued to stare, certain now that she had indeed grown a couple of inches, your eyes dipping slightly lower to get an even bigger shock; were her boobs bigger too?

"Um, I uh, I'm...I'm fine," you stuttered, trying to compose yourself a little, as you moved your gaze from the two small bumps in Emily's sweater back up to her face. "Huh-how about you, everything go okay at the doctor's?"

"Good yeah, just a check up, nothing too serious," she replied, smiling sweetly, before looking down at the magazine you were reading and taking an interest, as she casually continued chatting away, making no mention of having grown and acting just the same as usual.

You meanwhile, weren't sure what to make of it, her body definitely seeming slightly larger than it had been the previous night and you desperately wanting to ask her, just to make sure you weren't imagining things. As curious as you were however, you decided it best just to keep quiet, knowing that Emily was already rather self conscious when it came to her body, and not particularly wanting to draw anymore attention to it and risk upsetting her, doing your best to carry on as normal. That's when the most obvious explanation suddenly hit you; she must have stuffed her bra and put lifts in her shoes or something because she was feeling so inadequate compared to Clarissa, who's curvy body had certainly managed to capture your attention these last few days, and had no doubt been more than obvious to Emily.

"Shit, yeah, that's probably it. I mean, there's no way she could have actually grown," you thought to yourself, feeling incredibly guilty that Emily actually thought she had to go to all that trouble just to keep you interested, deciding then and there to show her as much affection as you could for the rest of the day.

Where will this story go next? Your choices are below...
1222111.title: Some small changes.

choices: You return home and your mother seems a bit different too.
The next day, you notice some slightly bigger changes in Emily.
12221112.content:
An addition by: Wassel29

The rest of the day went fairly fast, and you did your very best to pretend nothing was different around Emily, wondering if she was going to say anything to you herself, surely aware that you would be able to spot the obvious difference. She didn't however, and so you kept up your pretense, as well as pouring on the affection at every possible moment; holding hands with her through the entirety of lunch, hugging her tightly every chance you got, and doing your very best to avoid Clarissa Smith whenever possible.

"You not saying hello to her today?" Emily eventually asked you, noticing you eying Clarissa from across the hall, thinking you were being subtle, but clearly not.

"Say hello to who?" you innocently replied, feigning ignorance.

"Clarissa of course, who'd you think? She's been gazing over here for the last 5 minutes straight."

"Really? I hadn't noticed," you lied, your prying eye making you all too aware that she had, not wanting Emily to know that, as you then wrapped your arms around her slightly higher waist, and smiled, "Besides, why would I want to talk to her, when I've got you right here in front of me?"

"Okay, that’s really, really cheesy," Emily giggled, rolling her eyes a little, causing you both to laugh, before then doing something that came as a complete surprise to you; jumping up onto her tip toes and planting a soft, little kiss on your mouth. "Wow, what gives?" you wondered, having never known her, in the entire 3 months you'd been going out, to kiss you in public, usually turning bright red whenever you kissed her. Those lifts and padding must be doing their job, you thought, clearly giving her a much needed confidence boost.

- - -

Later, after the bell had rang for the end of day, you caught up with Emily heading out the main school doors, her small legs moving rather quickly, as if she was incredibly anxious to get home. "Whoa, Em, wait up!” you said, as you grabbed her arm, putting a halt to her hurried pace, "If you move any faster I'm going to have to start calling you The Flash!"

"Heh-heh, sorry, just glad schools over is all," she said with a giggle, though still looking somewhat distracted.

"No problem, I just thought you might wanna head back to mine again is all."

"I can't tonight I'm afraid," Emily replied, once again taking you by surprise, usually jumping at the chance to spend time round at yours, "I've really got to get back home. You know, work on my science project and stuff."

“Oh, sure, no problem,” you told her, a little puzzled by the noticeable difference in her behavior, before quickly shrugging the feeling off, figuring that perhaps she did really have a project to finish, after all, she had been doing all that scribbling in her notebook these past few days. Saying your goodbyes and giving her a kiss, you then waved her off as she quickly scampered off down the street, walking faster than you’d ever seen her move before.

“Girls, I’ll never understand ‘em,” you chuckled, shaking your head, figuring it would just be you and your Xbox tonight then, at least until your mother got back, as you then followed the rest of the departing school crowd and headed off home yourself.

Where will this story go next? Your choices are below...
12221112.title: Emily rushes back home after school.

choices: You are interrupted before Emily can tell you what's going on.
Emily gives you a rather vague explanation.
122211122.content:
An addition by: Wassel29

The following day was Friday, and you woke up in a rather chipper mood, heading down to breakfast to find your mom still searching for her missing hairbrush, having practically torn the whole house apart looking for it.

"I'm sure it'll turn up somewhere," you assured her, before heading out the door, consumed with more important thoughts about your weekend, such as; seeing as you wouldn't be attending Jessica Caldwell's party tomorrow, what exactly were you going to do instead? Admittedly you were still kind of disappointed that Emily didn't want to go to it, pretending that it didn't bother you, but secretly being kind of curious, especially knowing that Clarissa was going to be there, the signals she'd been giving you the last couple of days having become somewhat hard to ignore. Still, your mom was going to be visiting your Aunt for the weekend, meaning you'd have the whole house to yourself, so perhaps you could find something else to occupy you. "Guess I could see if Emily wants to stay over," you thought to yourself with a smile, hoping that perhaps this new found confidence boost she'd gotten extended all the way to the bedroom, and that you might be able to persuade her into taking things a little further in your relationship, rubbing your hands together excitedly as you did.

- - -

"Guess who?" you heard Emily's voice say, sometime later, as her small hands clamped down over your eyes, outside the Biology department after 3rd period, followed by a cut and joyous, girlish giggle.

"I dunno," you chuckled, thinking it was about time she'd made an appearance, "Some girl who missed both Chemistry and Biology, and left her boyfriend without a lab partner maybe..."

Moving her hands from your face, and sliding them down your body to your chest, you then felt Emily squeeze tightly up against you, giving you a big hug from behind, as she said, "Bingo! Got it in one!"

"Don't tell me...another doctor’s appointment?" you asked, as you spun round to face her, looking down at her somewhat luminous face, her cheeks painted with a rosy glow, accompanied by a big, warm grin. "Maybe," she giggled cryptically, causing you to laugh, her confidence seemingly having doubled over night as she snuggled up against you, caring little of the other students strolling casually past. As you looked down at her, you wondered to yourself if she'd gone and gotten even bigger lifts than the day before, the top of her head now almost equal with your chin, whereas it had always been much lower down. "Yikes!" you thought, becoming concerned that perhaps Emily was getting a little bit carried away with the whole confidence boosting thing, assuming that all these supposed trips to the doctors must have, in fact, been to the shoe store.

"You uh, you seem pretty happy today," you rather awkwardly said, really wanting to say something about her added height, but chickening out at the last minute.

Breaking the hug and taking a step back, Emily responded with an enthusiastic smile, "I feel pretty happy too, must be something to do with seeing you."

"Heh-heh, must b- -" you began, cutting yourself off mid sentence when you suddenly noticed something else that had changed; her small almost nonexistent breasts, than had gained maybe half a cup size yesterday, now looked like they'd gained an extra one on top of that! After finishing some dishes, she lets out a satisfied hum. Then she wipes her hands with a towel and takes a moment to stare at you with a small smile. You're currently glued to your phone while your hand automatically moves to grab a cookie.

She clears her throat to grab your attention.

You blink and before looking at your aunt, you see that the plate is almost half empty. Embarrassed, you quickly apologize.

"Oh, sorry! I didn't even realize that I was eating so much!"

Julia chuckles. "That's okay! I'm glad you enjoy it but how about we watch a movie together? I just rented out The Galorbafish!"

You widen your eyes. "Wait...isn't that the one with the human with a giant blobfish head who wants to get revenge on the people who experimented on him?"

Your aunt grins. "The very one. This one is so bad I heard, people laughed themselves to death!"

"Oh Aunt Julia, your movie tastes are glorious!"

She chuckled with pride and moved to set up the obvious disaster that is the film, but not the boring in the slightest. Meanwhile, you wash your hands from the cookie crumbs.

When you arrive back to Julia, you see her taking up the whole space of the couch as she lies down with a pillow behind her head. Smiling at you as if nothing is wrong, she raises her arms open and motions with her hands.

"Come here, sweetie! The movie is about to start!"

"Uh...I would, but you're taking one hundred percent of the couch."

Julia giggles. "Of course I am! Remember when you were little and we'd cuddle together? I'd like to try that again!"

You open your mouth, a little shocked. Sure, when you were little, you'd rest on top of her while she held you, but you were much older. Not to mention the fact you'd have to rest your head on top of her large chest.

"Come on, sweetie...please?"

You curl your lips and slowly move to your aunt, not wanting to disappoint her. Although, it seems weird that she wants to do this sort of thing so suddenly.

Gulping, you position your bottom between her legs, then lower your back down. With no other place to rest your head, your only options is your aunt's personal "pillows".

You blush deeply as her chest cushions your head and in order to see the movie, you had to turn a bit sideways. Despite wearing clothes and a tight bra, her chest is soft to your cheek's touch.

Julia giggles again and rests her arms at your chest and sways a little, making your head wobble a little. You take a deep breath and clear your throat.

"Um...aren't I a bit heavy?"

She hums, closing her eyes for a bit. "No, you're just perfect."

During the movie, what happens?
13211.title: Cuddling with the Aunt.

132111.content:
For just a few minutes, you are able to forget about how Julia is cradling you like you're young or the fact that you're aware of her enormous chest.

Then, your aunt begins to touch you, sliding one hand through your hair while the other rubs your chest circular. You open your mouth, wanting to say something but stop.

Her strokes are comforting to you and while lying on top of her chest like a pillow, it's hard to keep your eyes on the TV screen. You decide to play it positively.

"Um...Aunt Julia, I'm going to fall asleep if you keep doing that."

Julia hums, amused. "Is that bad? Do you want me to stop?"

"Er..."

Seeing your internal dilemma on your expression, she giggles. "I'll take that as a no then. Just relax, okay? We're not even at the best part yet."

"R-right."

Seeing you agree, she continues to play with your head and lovingly rub your upper body.

Do you fall asleep?

1321111.content:
Playing this movie is just a step into tempting you to relax like how you used to when you were little. Julia cared little for the movie itself and watched as you fell asleep.

'I'm taking him away from you, Karen,' Julia thinks in her mind without regrets. Ever since she saw you when you were born and grow up before her eyes, she wanted a child of her own.

But, she does not want to marry. She rather likes the single life. Plus, even if she married and had her own child, she could not guarantee the baby would grow up as you did.

She wanted you, specifically, not someone else.

Now that you're asleep, she could move forward that plan. There are always risks and you may even reject her, but she has fallback plans.

Knowing that once you fell asleep, you'd sleep rather heavily, she readjusts your position, being careful not to be too abrupt. Soon, you were lying on top of her lap as she sat upright.

Unaware, you breathe evenly. What happens?
1321111.title: Yes

choices: Julie wakes up for morning while you're asleep and continues the hypnosis.
Your mother, Karen comes over to visit her sister and check up on you.
13211111.content:
Julia had long prepared a message she recorded to mentally mold you into accepting her as your mother through a form of sleep hypnosis.

The first thing she had to do is get you to lower your guard, which you usually do around her anyway given your close relationship as nephew and aunt. To that end, offering her famous cookies always put you in a happy mood.

The second requirement would be attaching herself close to you through the sleep hypnosis in a way that also brought back familiar memories. This is why she insisted on reliving the time when you'd rest together on the couch.

After those two requirements, sleep hypnosis would be most effective but not immediate. Since you'd be in her grasp for the week, she had plenty of time to lower your guard further and make it so that it's difficult to think of her as anyone but your mother.

Soon, her sister would be nothing more but a second-class mother or even a stranger in comparison to her. No amount of hugs or love would satisfy you unless it came directly from her.

Pulling out the headphones she hit away through the underside of the couch, she had it already wirelessly connected to her phone and slipped them onto your defenseless ears.

Then, she played a repeating message that began to chip away at the facts of your life...

'Aunt Julia is your true mommy. Let her take care of you and spoil you.'

This proclamation she recorded resounds in your mind and before long, your dream of the fish movie transforms into one where she saves you from the perils of the monster, cradling you close to her chest and comforting you by nursing.

The events in your dream progress smoothly and you don't think of anything as a spell takes hold of you, hiding the facts of reality.

...

When you wake up, you are half-expecting to see Julia still nursing you and even giving you some pleasure. It's only when you notice that it's dark outside and the fact that you are back inside her home alone that you realize you fell asleep during the movie.

"Where's mommy?" you wonder aloud. Only after a few moments do you widen your eyes and clasp your hand over your mouth.

'Wait...mommy? She's...my aunt!'

Feeling strange inside, you try to dismiss it. Based on how quiet it is, you figure that your aunt went ahead to sleep. If she had heard you refer to her as 'mommy', you might die from embarrassment.

You wish she had woke you up. Even if the movie is bad and you wouldn't miss anything, you'd rather remain awake and not open your eyes when it's already dark. Because of this, you didn't feel like going back to sleep.

Sighing, you move to drink a glass of water and then notice that the table is filled with a pot of stew and a note with a smiley face.

'Sorry! I didn't want to wake my baby. Warm up this stew if needed and wake me up if you need anything.'

Hearing her refer to you as her 'baby' makes you feel embarrassed and you figure she's only teasing you since you fell asleep on top of her. Still, you appreciate her hospitality and the food she makes, so you don't hold anything back.

Eating by yourself while reading a book on your phone, you finish the stew and store the remaining into the fridge. Scratching your belly a little, you had a thought.

'I need some milk...'

Without thinking on it, you leave the fridge to go and wake Aunt Julia. Just before reaching out to open her door though, you stop.

'Wait...why am I going into her room!?'

Realizing you are just about to disturb her, you palm your head silently and quickly leave. Opening up the fridge once more, you grab some fresh dairy milk and pour yourself a glass.

Chugging down the cold milk, you gasp refreshed and then curl your lips, a little disappointed for some reason.

'Something's wrong with me...'

Not wanting to think on it further, you open your laptop you brought and decided to finish an essay that would be due after this week break is over. Although you want to procrastinate, you don't have anything else better to do and the dream you had would only cause you to look at some adult content which you didn't want to risk while you're a guest in her home.

So, you remain awake through the night before you felt tired. Only when it turned to dawn did you go back to sleep, changing into something more comfortable and sitting on the couch.

What happens?
13211111.title: Subconscious implanting.

choices: To her surprise, you drift to Julia and hug her instead.
You hug Karen like usual, your mind still relatively clear on who's your mother.
Unexpectedly, you hug Karen more thoroughly and feel a greater attachment to her
132111112.content:
With your sleep schedule thrown off, you don't wake up as the doorbell rings.

Aunt Julia who had woken up an hour ago and had changed was eager to get back to molding you into her beloved son, but it looks like an annoyance had come to her door.

Forcing a smile, Julia sees your mother and her sister, Karen   behind the door. If one could describe her, she is a true MILF who's busty in her own right. Even though Julia is younger and has more chest, the two sisters can draw eyes regardless.

"Hey there, sis!" Julia greets as she opens the door.

Karen steps in with her purse and smiles, hugging her little sister. "Hey! I just thought I'd stop by before going to work to check up on my baby boy."

Julia's eyes twitch a little, but she remained calm. Despite her best efforts to have you spend more time in her house than at your home, Karen's love isn't any less than hers. If it weren't for the fact that Karen has a more work-heavy job and isn't easily able to spend time with her family, Julia might not feel as confident to pull you away.

"He's sleeping like a baby. I guess he stayed up a little too much last night," Julia explains, chuckling as she and your mother stares at your snoring form on the couch.

"Well, he seems content enough. I can't thank you enough Julia for being such a hospitable aunt all these years. He's always happy to spend whatever time he has with you. So how are you?"

Julia shrugs. "I'm fine. You know the usual. Your son really brightens my life, you know?"

Karen huffs indignantly with a smile. "Well, he better! I don't want my son causing you trouble but at the same time, I can't let you hog him all the time. You're still young Julia, it's not to late to find someone and start your own family."

"...and I have answered that too many times," Julia dismisses.

Karen sighs and nods. "Well, I just don't want you to regret...that's all."

'...and I won't,' Julia thought in her head with a tiny curl in her lips, '...because soon, I'll have a son.'

Unaware of her little sister's plans, Karen has a refreshing chat with Julia with some tea. As they don't want to disturb you, neither of them wakes you but their chatter slowly rouses you until you open your eyes groggily.

The first sleep hypnosis session has actually been more effective than Julia had previously thought. If she had been aware that you nearly visited her room without thinking, she would have died happily.

"Mommy?" you mumble, hearing two voices.

Slowly, you rise and seeing your tired approach, both women gasps. Karen is the first to speak up.

"Oh, sweetie! We didn't mean to wake you! I'm just about to leave and just wanted to visit a little. Since you're half-up, can you give me a hug before I leave?"

Karen raises her arms expectantly with a warm smile as she stands up. Julia pursues her lips but doesn't stand up, not wanting to get in the way so early.

She would let you and your mother have a little moment for now.

What happens?
132111112.title: Sister Rivalry

choices: Julia carries out her next hypnosis session with a more active role.
At work, Karen notices something off on her phone.
1321111123.content:
Karen is a doting mother and as such, she often can't help but be touchy-feely with her family. Despite knowing your reluctance and how much you hate being babied by her, she continues to be affectionate because she wants to make sure you know that you're loved and appreciated, even though it's well fermented in your mind and you don't need any proof.

'He's probably going to complain, as usual,' Karen figures but that doesn't stop her from requesting as you groggily approach her and her sister.

To her surprise, you enter her space without complaint and wrapped your arms lovingly around her waist. Closing the gap, you squeeze causing her chest to be pushed up against you and she freezes as you nuzzle into her neck, breathing in bliss.

"Mommy..."

Karen widens her eyes. She and Julia didn't quite hear it as you got up from the couch, but she doesn't mistake such an endearing term she loved to hear from you when you were young. As you got older, you started to call her just "mom".

"B-baby?" Karen questions, quite confused. This is unlike her son though as she feels your warmth, she feels something she thought missing well up inside of her.

She has no idea why you're so acting so comfortably, even perhaps daring, but she knows she can't miss out on this chance.

"Oh, baby...I love you so much."

Wrapping her arms around you, she closes her eyes and hums happily. Unable to help feel emotional, she spills some tears on her face and lets out a shaky breath. She feels silly for crying, but you're suddenly hugging her so nicely that it brings back memories of when you were young.

Meanwhile, Julia's mouth hangs at this unexpected emotional scene.

'Could it be that my hypnosis is causing this?'

Unsure, she knows that this development isn't good for her plan and tries to break you and her up immediately.

Clearing her throat, she snaps them both out of it. "Hey! Are you trying to rub it in for me?"

Hearing her sister's voice, Karen gasps and pulls away. Embarrassed, she provides a silly apologetic smile. "Sorry sis, I...got carried away there."

You blink, feeling suddenly confused. Your actions just now are clear to you but your mind is fuzzy on the reasoning.

'Wait...what did I just do?' you think.

Furrowing your eyebrows, you start to feel a headache coming along and grunt, grabbing your head with one hand.

Seeing this, Karen's concern jumps and she closes the gap between you and her while placing a hand on top of your head. "Sweetie, are you okay?"

Feeling rather annoyed, you nudge her away and dismiss her. "Mom, I'm fine! I think I need to go back to sleep. Anyways, you should be at work, shouldn't you?"

Karen once more freezes and it feels like glass has shattered inside of her as she sees you return to your usual self. Gulping, she forces a smile and steps back, giving you space.

"O-of course. I just...wanted to check up on you and my sister, that's all. At any point, if you want to come home early, Julia can drop you off or I can pick you up."

You know your mom means well and nod, though you don't think she should be worried about you so much. "I'll let you know if it comes to it, but I think I'll be fine!"

You pause, noticing some shimmering tear marks on her cheek. "Wait, have you been crying?"

Karen gasps, quickly wiping her face a little and then shakes her head. "It's...nothing."

She seems a little sad behind her smile but you don't question it, even though you wonder if something is going on. At the end of the day, she's still your mother and you'd make an effort to protect her if anything is hurting her.

At the moment though, your small headache is making it hard for you to want to inquire any further, so you head back to the couch to lie your head.

Sighing, Karen returns her attention to her sister who is trying to hide her smile, full of intentions. "Take good care of him, okay?"

Julia chuckles amicably. "Of course! To be honest sis, I think you spoil him too much."

Karen hums and stares at your form on the couch with dissatisfaction. Her voice is low as she mumbles. "I wish I could."

After some more exchange, Karen leaves her sister's house leaving you alone with Julia. Knowing you're still awake as you try to nap off your headache, she waits for more opportunities to pull you away to her side.
1321111123.title: A Little Backfire.

choices: She comes to the conclusion that her sister is taking her son away!

13211111232.content:
'Was I just imagining it?' Karen thinks as she sits in her office, closed-door.

She never thought in ages that her son would hug her so fully, perhaps even sensually. She thought nothing wrong with it, but it was unbecoming of you as you have tried to distance yourself from her so many times.

Leaning forward and burying her face into her hands, she let a long sigh drift in her space.

'I wish we could become close like that again. When was the last time I spent time with him? I know he wants nothing to do with me and yet, he's happily going off to see my sister! It's unfair!'

Removing her head, she grimaces and then takes a look at her phone. Needing to take some time to clear her mind so that she can properly work, she looks for some music on her phone to play.

Then, she sees something strange.

"A...recording? I...oh that's right!" she speaks out loud.

A while ago, Karen asked her sister to sync some of her music to her phone since she believed she has a better musical taste. In general, Karen is one of those types who tend to listen to the same song over and over, unsure of how to research other music. Since the two sisters have pretty similar tastes while growing up, Karen decides to refer to Julia since she'll happen to be caught up better than she is.

It looks like her phone automatically synced when she was nearby when it should have been a one-time thing.

"I should delete it. It's not my business...huh?"

Karen was about to delete the recording from her phone out of respect for her sister until she saw the filename: "mommy-step-1.mp4"

Curling her lips, Karen is conflicted on whether to listen to it or stay away but ultimately, the "mommy" carries too much weight for her to dismiss it, especially after the fleeting dream she experienced with her son hours ago.

'Sorry Julia, I can't help it!' Karen apologizes in her mind and then sets up her headphones.

She doesn't know what to expect but when she starts hearing her sister's voice, her mouth hangs in shock with a simple sentence being repeated in a loop.

'Aunt Julia is your true mommy. Let her take care of you and spoil you.'

'Aunt Julia is your true mommy. Let her take care of you and spoil you.'

'Aunt Julia is your true mommy. Let her take care of you and spoil you.'

"No!"

Snapping out of her shock, Karen takes off her headphones and pauses the recording with frantic movements. After several seconds of silence and her mind trying to process what existed on her sister's phone, she buries her face into her hands once more.

'I...don't understand. What could this be for?' she asks.

What does Karen make of this?
13211111232.title: The Phone Sync.

"Do you have to boom-boom before I call a cab? Yaknow they charge if you have accidents, sweetheart."
13311.title: Uncle Sally takes you back to 'her' home.

1341.content:
Amanda Ryan   is your twenty-six-year-old sister. Since you were born, she has always been super attached to you and apparently, even tried to breastfeed you as a baby when your mother wasn't around!

While it may be nice to have such a loving older sister who's taken the best genetic features of your mother, Gina and your deceased father, Jerry, it can be sometimes annoying when you'd rather have her let off.

What you don't know is that reincarnation is a real thing. It just so happens that Amanda remembers everything in each one of her past lives and she also knows that you are her past son instinctively! To make matters worse, she was also your lover in an era of ancient magic that was forgotten!

With secret knowledge of old magic and deep-rooted feelings for you, she is bent on connecting with you and forcing you to remember your past lives!

Things really begin...
1341.title: Reincarnated Mother

choices: To unlock your past life as Persey.
13411.content:
"Hurry! It won't be long before they breach the gate!"

"Persey, there's nowhere to run!"

Flames and the roars of powerful forces beyond most people's comprehensions laid about the castle walls in the city of Kondua. The Dracosian civilization, a society that was way past its time would soon be forgotten on the history of the Earth.

Except, it would live on in the memory of the other...

"There is...or rather, I'll make sure that you'll at least survive in memory, Zaria."

"W-what are you saying?"

The two lovers, bearers of magic that would be long lost to the world arrived into a chamber with a crystal ball on a pedestal in the center. Persey wasted no time in touching it, then his gaze follows Zaria, his beautiful woman who has studied and endured with him in the learning of Earth's magic.

"Zaria, you trust me, don't you? There is a way for you to survive."

Zaria bites her lips and shakes, not liking what he's implying. "Why me? Love, don't say that. There is-"

"Reincarnation," Persey cuts her off, his eyes narrowing.

Zaria holds her breath, her eyes widening as she now understands her lover's intentions. The sounds of the enemy kingdoms and could be heard even into the chambers as they bang on the gate harder.

"You..." she begins, breathing out, "...you mean to preserve ourselves in the next life!"

Persey sighs and closed his eyes, shaking his head. "No...not ourselves, only you."

"N-no! We can both perform the reincarnation magic, can't we? Why must it just be me?! I don't want to live alone without you!"

"Zaria!" Persey shouts, a drop of sweat falling from his head as time becomes precious and limited, "...there is only enough time for us to cast one spell. You will preserve your own history and knowledge...and I will destroy it."

"D-destroy?"

Persey breathes through his nose and looks at his surroundings with pride. "I'm afraid...the world isn't ready yet. We cannot let the other kingdoms steal the knowledge within these walls. I leave it to you to carry our knowledge instead and spread it when the time is right. We each have our own responsibility to carry out before ourselves, you must understand that!"

Tears well in Zaria's eyes but before she could protest, she sees the unwavering determination in her lover's eyes. No matter how difficult it is to accept, she knows there is no time and Persey would change his mind.

"This...is so unfair. H-how can I accept this?"

Persey gives a sad smile and the crystal ball glows, spreading a film of static electricity as Persey begins channeling into it. "I love you, Zaria. If you love me, then you will grant my wish and live your life in the next and after. Now, quickly!"

Zaria chokes, frustration and anguish filling her face. With her lover already starting the destruction sequence, she has no choice but to perform the reincarnation for herself. "D-damn you, Persey! I don't want to be alone!"

Channeling her own energy into the crystal ball, she begins to glow this time. Tears streams down her cheeks as she gazes at Persey who smiles, wrly.

"I may not remember you in the next life, but know that I'll still be out there. I love you so much Zaria...and I hope that we meet again."

The chamber fills with light and the sounds of the gate breaking down could be heard. She gives one last smile towards her lover. "Goodbye, my love. I won't stop until I find you!"

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------

Iris, a woman in her mid-twenties gasps and breaths in sharply with sweat dripping from her forehead. Her knees collapse and in the hospital bed, the only relief she receives to the pain she has endured so far is the cry of a baby...her son.

Tears well in her eyes. "Is he..."

The nurse and doctor move quickly to clean the baby and wrap him up before delivering him to Iris who quivers at the sight of her first newborn.

"...he is more than well, ma'am. Congratulations to your son!" the nurse announces.

She feels elated and takes her son into her arms who cries with healthy lungs. "Oh...m-my...baby..."

Iris sniffles, gazing at her newborn with unbelievable happiness and relief. Her husband takes pictures using a Polaroid camera with a proud smile before joining at her side.

"He's beautiful," Iris states to which her husband could only hum, placing a comforting hand on her shoulder.

"We said we'll decide on a name for him when he's finally in our world, didn't we? What should his name be?"

Iris chuckles at the long list of names she and her husband spent hours compiling. There is only one name she refused to mention or pick if it ever came up.

However, something causes Iris to stop as she gazes at her firstborn son. She couldn't place her finger on it, but the cry...it resonated with her more than just her maternal instincts. She takes a deep breath in disbelief.

"It can't be..." she whispers.

Iris' husband furrows her eyebrows, "Uh...honey?"

"Persey." she declares firmly.

"W-what?"

"Persey, that will be his name," she reiterates with her heart jumping higher than ever.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------------------------

Fate is cruel.

The woman known as Zaria reincarnated into many individuals, trying to live her life to the fullest as her past lover wished. Although having increasing memories of every life she lived is confusing and even painful, she did her best.

Yet, just when she found the past lover in the form of her new son, she attracted a form of cancer that didn't have a known treatment back then. As a result, she only spent a few years with her son only to die again.

Thus, life continues on and while fate may be cruel, it can also be a blessing.

This is especially the feeling that your sister, Amanda holds who stares at you with love and pride, singing along with your parents and friends as they wish you a happy birthday.

Embarrassed, especially due to your sister who always gazes at you with so much affection, you try your best to compose yourself through the awkward happy birthday song, then finally blow out the candles to a new year and a new beginning...

"I'm so happy, my sweet little brother!"

Before you could say anything, Amanda hugs you after catching you away from your friends who are leaving your home with good wishes and hopefully good presents.

Of course, Amanda is always rewarding you with contact. You try to pull away, clearing your throat.

"Uhm...that's enough, sis! H-hey, can we cut the touchy-feeling stuff now that I'm an adult?"

"Nuh-uh! No matter how old you are, you'll still be my sweet, son..."

"Uh..."

Amanda halts and then pulls away, giggling nervously. "I mean, brother! Brother...that's what I meant!"

You stare at her strangely and silence falls between you. She sweats a little though, this is not the first time she's slipped up with you.

"Sis, can I say something?" you ask.

"S-sure! Go ahead!"

"You seriously need to get yourself a boyfriend!"

Amanda gasps dramatically. "No! Why would I need that if I already have you!?"

You roll your eyes and groan, her giggles echoing into your ears. "Ugh...that's not even funny anymore."

If you had to describe your older sister in one word, it would be...weird. For as long as you can remember, she's been saying some rather strange things to you. What's even stranger is that despite being asked out by many boys, she always refuses and prefers to spend time with you whenever she can.

Sometimes, she feels like an overbearing second mother to you. Other times, she feels like that awkward older sister that you'd rather not have people know. Then and most problematic, she sometimes acts like she's married to you or something.

Regardless of how she's acting, it can't be healthy for you or her, so you've been trying to constantly push her away, but she doesn't seem to be the least deterred.

You aren't going to deny it either - Amanda is hot and despite being family, her persistent attempts to cuddle with you and keep you close to her has made you awaken a little to the fact that you'd go on the deep end if this continued.

At the moment, you needed to get away from her. "Whatever, I'm going to bed now...and before you ask, NO."

Amanda chuckles at your reluctance to let her cuddle with you in bed. Truthfully, she had to perform some spells to her parents so that they wouldn't see the harm in the idea of their siblings getting close like this.

But, since today is your birthday, she decides to respect your wishes.

"Alright fine!" she answers, raising her hands in a loss, "...I'll give you a moment in your little adulthood!"

You stare at her suspiciously before sighing and getting away from her. Unbeknownst to you though, Amanda already has plans in motion to enact.

She has been preparing meticulously as you were growing up by getting you used to the forgotten magic that your past self destroyed knowledge of. Every bit of contact she had with you was to help you adjust to her magic and now that you're eighteen, she's confident you'll be able to withstand a spell of hers.

What is the spell?
13411.title: ...on your Eighteenth birthday.

info.brief_description: A remake. A female close to you wants to be your new mother. 2,000GPs for good adds!
info.description:
So there was this story on Writing.com way back when I first started that was awesome, where a woman close to you wanted to be your new Mother by any means possible. It got taken down years ago and I found parts of it on wayback machine, I figured we should bring it back and expand on it.

Anything can happen with a few exceptions labelled below.

1. No death unless the person can come back from it.
2. Keep it Mother and son, other women being introduced is fine as well but the protagonist is male at the start.

Try and make a paragraph at least in your chapters unless its a choice for what the mother is. I will offer 2,000GPs for good posts, have fun now. :)

Here is the original on Wayback Machine if you want to view it.
https://web.archive.org/web/20130530152941/http://www.writing.com:80/main/intera...
